started by the same people who launched Calvert mutual funds uh more than 35
years ago um and they were one of the first along with Domin um one of the
first mutual funds that had funds dedicated to social investing and at the
time social investing was thought of very narrowly as investing where there
were some type of in in those days negative screen so where you were screening out publicly traded stocks and

many people will remember or have heard of at least if you're from a younger generation where there was disinvestment
in South Africa um and calv mutual funds was very proud to be one of the first
mutual funds to disinvest from South Africa doing apar tide and then one of the first to go back in when AP partide
ended and so over time socially responsible investing really came to
include positive screening as well not just negative screening out of publicly traded stocks and bonds but also looking

environmental behaviors governance behaviors um and in recent history
Calbert Investments has been quite active in promoting gender equity on boards um in a governance with a with a
